alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Collier. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains have been occurring over this area for the last serial hours . Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over this area since this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area is still possible with the ongoing line of showers and thunderstorms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than freakiest, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naples, Marco Island, Everglades City, Royal Palm Hammock, Marco Island Airport, Cape Romano, Belle Meade, Lely Resort, Naples Manor, East Naples, Plantation Island, Big Cypress National Preserve, Everglades National Park, Goodland, Key Marco, Cape Romano Aquatic Preserve, Port Of The Island, Fiddlers Creek, Rookery Bay Aquatic Preserve and Lely. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
